thread.title: Enormous Bird Nests of the Sociable Weaver, Namibia

author: Gary
title: Enormous Bird Nests of the Sociable Weaver, Namibia
text:
Enormous Bird Nests of the Sociable Weaver, Namibia 
Camera NIKON D300S Aperture f/5 Exposure Time 1/500 
The bird nests of the sociable weaver are the largest bird nests in the world. They can house over 100 birds and are one of the few examples of colonial nesting on Earth. Get My FREE 100 Page Travel Photography eBook! 
One Response to "Enormous Bird Nests of the Sociable Weaver, Namibia" By Wendy@TheNomadicVegan September 16, 2015 - 12:39 pm 
Hi Gary, I discovered your blog through the collaborative post that we both contributed to on One Weird Globe (though I’d heard your name bantered around before then), so I thought I would stop by and say “Hi”! Your photographs are gorgeous. Namibia is a country that’s definitely on my list, and now I can’t wait to see these huge nests, and hopefully the birds themselves. I’m assuming if they really are sociable they like to come out and meet human visitors, no?
